result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlo D Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with LM or her children.

Mental health assessment.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Sentencing hearing on May 16, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Count 1, GUILTY (not guilty also included)

State submitted information.  Court goes over jail phone calls prior to jurors coming into court.  Court rules on phone calls.  Jurors brought in at 9.  State calls witnesses, sworn takes stand.  Direct exam by ADA Cardona, cross exam by Atty. Karpe.   Marked exhibits 25-32. Exhibits 25-27 to be offered and received, not not allowed to go to the Jury.  Offered and received exhibits 29 and 31.  Jurors excused.  State rests off record.  Atty. Karpe move to dismiss all counts on grounds that evidence is not sufficient, and would like count 1, robbery to be outrights dismissed in case 14cf2486.  Court will not dismiss at this point, but will entertain any motions after all evidence is in.  Court has colloquy with Mr. Williams on if has choosen to testify.  Mr. WIlliams chooses not to testify.  Jurors brought back in at 11:13.  State rests.  Atty. Karpe calls witnesses, sworn, takes stand.  Direct exam by Atty. Karpe, cross exam by ADA Cardona.  Defense rests.  Jurors break for lunch at 11:35, back by 12:45.  Atty. Karpe does not object to the amended information, changing count 1 on case 14cf2486.  Court and parties go over jury instructions.  Atty. Karpe again motions for dismissal of count 1 on case 14cf2486, Court acknowledges motion, but will hold on her rulilng at this time.  Jurors brought back in at 1:12.  Court reads jury instructions.  Alternates picked, excused at 1:15.  Court starts jury instructions.  Closing arguments by ADA Cardona, closing by Atty. Karpe.  Rebuttal arguments by DDA Stephan.  Bailiff sworn at 2:55, jurors excused for deliberations at 2:57.
Counsel agree to exhibits 1,4,5,6,7,9,13,14,15,16 to be released to jury.  Verdict in at 4:25.  Counsel called.  Jurors in at 4:45.  Foreperson hands verdict to bailiff.  Court reads verdict.  On case 14cf2486, count 1 NOT GUILTY, count 2,3 and 4, - GUILTY.  Case 15CF1169, count 1 GUILTY.  Case 15CF335, count 1 GUILTY, count 2 NOT GUILTY.  Court polls juryr.  All jurors agree.  Jurors excused at 4:50.  State motions for judgment on the verdict.  revocation of bail, and requests PSI.  Court wants to proceed to sentencing; State is not in compliance with Chapter 950.  Court orders PSI.  Court adjourned at 5:15.
State's
Exhibits 1-32. Exhibits 1-11, 13-16, 29, & 31 received.  Exhibits 3, 10, 29, & 31 are CD's and not scanned.  Exhibit 1 is oversized and not scanned.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney David Karpe.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jurors brought up, sworn.  Court reads preliminary instructions.  Clerk calls 24 names.  Court continues preliminary instructions.  Court does voir dire.  Court strikes juror MB number 71, clerk calls another juror.  Court strikes juror KS number 85, Clerk calls another juror.  Voir Dire by ADA Cardona.  Court strikes juror RS, Clerk calls another juror.  Voir Dire by Atty. Karpe.  Non called jurors are excused.  Strikes start.  Strikes done.  Clerk calls 14 names.  non selected jurors excused.  Court finishes preliminary instructions.  Jurors to return Thursday, March 17, 2016 at 8:15.  Jurors excused at 2:05.  No motions as this time.  Court adjourned.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney David Karpe.  Mauricio Cardona appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Karpe requesting video conferencing for testimony.  State does not object.  Court asks what system they will be using.  They do not know at this time.  State requests a Ludwig Hearing be held.  Count 1 on this case or 15CF335, PSI request, cap at 4 years initinal confinement.  Offer good until the end of the hearing.  Mr. Williams wants to discharge Mr. Karpe.  He is attorney number 5.  Court has collequy with Mr. Williams.  Court finds that Mr. Williams is competent and waives his right to attorney.  Atty. Karpe will be stand by counsel to be paid by the County.  Mr. Williams is expected to follow all rules of the court.  Instructions/motions/witness lists due by noon on 3/10/16.  Court adjourned.
